Class RandomBrickGenerator

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.logic.RandomBrickGenerator
All Implemented Interfaces:
BrickGenerator
public class RandomBrickGenerator extends Object implements BrickGenerator
A simple random (bag) brick generator.

Maintains an internal buffer of upcoming bricks and exposes a peek API so GUI code can render previews. Uses a shuffled bag approach for fairness (i.e. one permutation of all seven tetrominoes is produced before repeating).

Behavior notes: - The generator keeps a small buffer of upcoming bricks (see BUFFER_SIZE). - getBrick() consumes and returns the head of the queue; callers may call getUpcomingBricks(int) to obtain a stable preview list. - replaceNext(Brick) replaces the immediate next brick while preserving the remainder of the queue order.

Threading: this implementation is not synchronized and should be used by a single game thread. If shared between threads, external synchronization is required.

      Description copied from interface: BrickGenerator
      Peek upcoming bricks without consuming them. Default implementation returns an empty list.

      Parameters:

    • replaceNext

      public boolean replaceNext(Brick replacement)
      Description copied from interface: BrickGenerator
      Replace the head 'next' brick with the provided replacement without altering the remainder of the queue.
      Specified by:
      replaceNext in interface BrickGenerator
      Parameters:
      replacement - the brick to place at the head of the upcoming queue
      Returns:
      true if the replacement succeeded, false otherwise (e.g. when the generator has no next element)
